What happens at a KHD?

Whether you’re into computers, arts, music, science the combined personal interests of you and your team will of course affect the theme of your event. What happens at a Kids Hack Day is not constrained to specific topics and can really incorporate anything (also see “what happens at a khd event”). While the focus is on technology hacking is really all about a mindset. All Kids Hack Day events are unified through this hacker mindset. A shared belief that if we can invoke the little hacker inside all of us, the world would be a much better place.

Tools and partners

Read about our amazing partners and become one yourself! Are you passionate about 21st century skills and empowering kids to become makers of their own future? Do you sell physical and/or digital products that enables kids to do exactly this but are struggling to build a global community with people that can expand your vision? Then you have come to the right place! Kids Hack Day welcomes partners who shares our values and strive towards the same goals. Together we can achieve great things! Read more about our partner program here.

Global partners: < > Quirkbot, Strawbees, Creatubbles

Creatubbles

Creatubbles is a safe online community for creative kids, teachers and parents. Thanks to the Kids Hack Day gallery on Creatubbles, kids participating in our events can interact with kids from other events across the globe simply through the projects they are making and uploading to our Creatubbles gallery. If you're a KHD organizer you can use Creatubbles to engage your attendees in helping you document everything that's beeing made at your event.

Quirkbot

Quirkbot is a creative and educational robotics platform for kids that allows them to build and program their own robots from scratch in just a matter of minutes. Quirkbot allows for the use of everyday materials and brings life to the objects around you. Check out what you can make on www.quirkbot.com/build.

Strawbees

Strawbees is a construciton toy for kids of all ages that allows you to connect straws and card-board in other to invent whatever you want. Check out what you can make here! http://education.strawbees.com/maker-activities/
